page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{ARNSIDE PIER
Apart from the shops the main feature of the Promenade is the Pier. It was built in the 1850's by The Ulverston and Lancaster Railway company to replace an earlier wooden structure when the construction of the railway viaduct across the estuary prevented ships from reaching the port of Milnthorpe. After storm damage in the late 1930's it was repaired by the London, Midland and Scottish Railway Company. It was sold to Arnside Parish Council by British Rail for Â£100 in 1964. A storm in January 1983 destroyed the causeway which was rebuilt by public subscription at a cost of Â£25000.
